recipe_text: Quantity; 900; Prepare 900 grams of branzino fish, cleaned and scaled| Measurement; 60; Measure out 60 grams of olive oil| Measurement; 10; Measure out 10 grams of garlic, minced| Measurement; 60; Measure out 60 grams of lemon juice| Measurement; 5; Measure out 5 grams of dried oregano| Measurement; 5; Measure out 5 grams of salt| Measurement; 2; Measure out 2 grams of black pepper| Measurement; 200; Measure out 200 grams of cherry tomatoes, halved| Measurement; 100; Measure out 100 grams of kalamata olives, pitted| Measurement; 10; Measure out 10 grams of fresh parsley, chopped| Untimed; None; Preheat oven to 200 degrees C (400 degrees F)| Untimed; None; In a small bowl, combine olive oil, garlic, lemon juice, oregano, salt, and black pepper| Untimed; None; Place branzino in a baking dish and pour the olive oil mixture over it| Untimed; None; Scatter cherry tomatoes and olives around the fish| Untimed; None; Bake in the preheated oven| Timed; 1200; Bake for 20 minutes, or until fish is cooked through| Untimed; None; Garnish with fresh parsley| Finish; None; Serve hot!
title: Branzino Mediterranean
